an10.70:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an10.70:1.2: Now at that time, after the meal, on return from almsround, several mendicants sat together in the assembly hall.
an10.70:1.3: They engaged in all kinds of low talk, such as talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and nations; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; miscellaneous talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.
an10.70:2.1: “Mendicants, there are ten grounds for praise.
an10.70:2.3: It’s when a mendicant personally has few wishes, and speaks to the mendicants on having few wishes.
an10.70:2.4: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:3.1: A mendicant personally is content, and speaks to the mendicants on contentment.
an10.70:3.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:4.1: A mendicant personally is secluded, and speaks to the mendicants on seclusion.
an10.70:4.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:5.1: A mendicant personally doesn’t mix closely with others, and speaks to the mendicants on not mixing closely with others.
an10.70:5.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:6.1: A mendicant personally is energetic, and speaks to the mendicants on being energetic.
an10.70:6.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:7.1: A mendicant personally is accomplished in ethics, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in ethics.
an10.70:7.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:8.1: A mendicant personally is accomplished in immersion, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in immersion.
an10.70:8.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:9.1: A mendicant personally is accomplished in wisdom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in wisdom.
an10.70:9.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:10.1: A mendicant personally is accomplished in freedom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in freedom.
an10.70:10.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:11.1: A mendicant personally is accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.70:11.2: This is a ground for praise.
an10.70:12.1: These are the ten grounds for praise.”
